> [oracle](#comment_42_1ED3Ho3kmzaKiECtyuqSjDpoE47rKuXeP): I don't know sql yet, I'm a newbie just learning to code and I hate it. But I do know if this project is to survive and get people to use it,  it's going to half to be a lot more user friendly for people who can't code. I look at it this way, why would a person leave wordpress or blogspot that has an dashboard to easily manage your blog for a blog that's harder to run because you have to code, they won't. So I'm trying to learn to code so I can try to make a dashboard. Did I mention I hate coding, damn it sucks and not in a good way.

nice. i hate coding too. but i do it many years already and i like the posebilitys i get. you get better by time :).

> [oracle](#comment_43_1ED3Ho3kmzaKiECtyuqSjDpoE47rKuXeP): I've never had one day of schooling in coding, when I graduated my school never had computers so I'm trying to learn all by myself and it seems virtually impossible. I have no coding experience what so ever. It's very difficult to learn and I'm going to http://www.w3schools.com/ but it still it's hard to understand. I'm starting to believe not everybody can code. I wanted to try to create a dashboard to make the blog more user friendly for people who can't code but that's hard to do when I can't code myself. People that can't code will not use ZeroNet. ZeroNet is a great project but if it doesn't have things like a simple dashboard to make it user friendly for non coders then it's doomed like FreeNet.

try the javascript curse at https://www.khanacademy.org/ thats what you need. its fun and good explained. (and free)

as i see it works as follows for multi user sites:
every user gets a subfolder with a json file in it (and every user can modify his own json file)

after an update to a site zeronet generates the database from the json files for faster browsing.
